reviews.review: If half life is sex with a hooker, then Opposing force is the hug she gives you after that and tells you she believes you will achieve you goals and gives you a huge moral boost.
adrian shephard goes on an adventure to find his personal hell
A good expansion
fbi open up

Half-Life Opposing Force is very good
The new weapons are great, (LMG and deagle are especially fun), and  only has 2 chapters that make me want to tear my hair out (friendly fire and foxtrot uniform can go eat a long girth of slime) as opposed to the original half life where pretty much the entire second half plus on a rail are annoying. The final chapter of this game (ignoring the ear damage) is genuinely the most fun i have had out of the goldscr trilogy. The new enemies are also pretty cool, they really make you feel like black mesa is getting slowly getting fully overtaken by alien wildlife.
Anyways, if you liked the original half-life, you will probably love this. 8/10
very cool very epic

Вернитесь в Чёрную Мезу и посмотрите на конфликт с другой стороны.
Still fun in 2021!

half life but less linear, and better in some ways, worse in others.

Gostou de half life e ficou sedento por mais? Não tema, pois Half Life: Opposing Force está aqui! 

Desenvolvido pela Gearbox Software com alguma supervisão da Valve, Opposing Force é quase um jogo novo, que provavelmente vai levar o mesmo tempo da sua vida quanto Half-Life, e você nem vai notar ele passando até acabar sua jogatina. Inimigos novos, level design comparável a do original, armas... inovadoras... Opposing force tem de tudo que é necessário pra te divertir por horas e horas, seja explodindo aliens, transformando soldados em queijo suiço ou explorando as profundezas de Black Mesa.
Wow this Adrian Shephard guy seems cool, I hope we see more of him soon!

A small expansion that follows on the original's amazing level design. I didn't quite enjoy the story though, as it is almost non-existent, but nonetheless the game is fun as hell. Very recommended.

Дополнение хорошое, видимо Шепарду выдали новую разработку костюма и на самом деле он никакой не капрал, а генерал.
Таскаем куча оружек и патронов чуствуем себя отлично, но это все игровые условности. Про дополнение много чего говорить не буду, все итак его проходили и написали обзоры да и есть куча видео про него.
Скажу про баги.
1. (приведу одну ситуацию к примеру, а так их было куча) Стреляю я с этой змочки, и патроны кончились и думаю "Так надо взять дробаш и долбануть дуплетом". А с переди стоит шоковый солдат, хочу переключится на дробаш и кручу колесико мышы как обычно.
А вот ничего не происходит не выбирается, и я такой "Але блет давай переключайся на дробаш", а оно такое "Х*й тебе", а я такой "Ты чо а**ел? Давай переключайся.", а оно такое "А вот х*й тебе". А шоковый солдат говорит "Я тебе е**ло начищу.", а я такой "Б"я." и помер я.
2. Через половину игры когда я получил сннарков, почти перед финалом хотел снарков юзать, но они вот тоже не выбираются вот жму на них а они не выбираются, также так было с сачелькой и сламом.
3. Дигл обиделся и отказывался стрелять хотя у него были патроны.
Вроде все.
Из крутых фишек  отмечу:
1. ПНВ
2. Шатающиеся контейнеры
3. Барнакл (оружие не тот что нпс)

My personal experience :

I have spent the last week playing the original Half Life and it's DLCs. I was extremely impressed by these games - not only was the game-play and gun-play brilliant but so was the story. For any fan of the Half Life series that has only played Half Life 2 and beyond - I cannot recommend these games more.

Typically when you consider modded variants of a video game, you envision one of two things. The first is a buggy, obscure game introducing new features that are unpolished and don't fit, or a game that introduces absolutely nothing and is just a copy + paste of the original game with a few tweaks here and there. But this is no typical modded game, this is made by Valve, so you know it's gotta be good. Opposing force doesn't shy away from bringing in that gritty, military-esque atmosphere that was somewhat absent in the original half-life game, popping your straight into boot camp and establishing you are nothing more than a subordinate grunt, unlike the legendary Gordon Freeman in the first game. The way you interact with your fellow marines, guards, scientists, and other NPCs is also fresh. It implies that, simply you don't belong and that you are out of place, which aids in establishing this unique atmosphere which is carried out throughout the entirety of the playthrough. New enemies are interesting and challenging, adding another layer to that 'new' experience in half-life. Simply the addition of a wrench as opposed to a crowbar is also a nice touch as well. However, you, the player, simply being out of place in this environment doesn't take away from your own personal choices. You have been sent to quell the voice of these scientists, so do you? There are many little events and choices you can make to choose between sides. Do you do your job and help your brutish fellow soldiers, or do you side with humanity against these alien invaders. The choice is yours, and this freedom feels more expanded than it did in the regular half-life. 8.5 / 10, pretty epic.

Great expansion pack produced by Valve and Gearbox. Just like Half-Life blueshift, you play from the perspective of Corporal Shepard and the HECU talking place from the original story of Half-Life. It is much longer than Half-Life Blue Shift but is somewhat shorter than Half-Life.

Hopefully that didn’t sound too confusing :/

I recommend buying both of the expansions after playing Half-Life and viewing the story from the angle of two important figures in the story of the original game.

More aliens to shoot, more guns to shoot and more fun ways to traverse into the game, from the perspective of Corporal Shepard aka the soldiers who were sent to clean up Black Mesa. It is short campaign compare to Half-Life. It definitely doesn't have that much puzzle and tactical options compare to aforementioned game as well. But it is fun nonetheless.
